

**1**         **Compression costs**

The compression cost (CC) was computed using a similar formula to the one used for the levelized cost of hydrogen (LCOH), namely,

$$
CC = \frac{I_{comp} + \sum\limits_{n=1}^{N} \frac{c^{comp}}{(1 + i)^n}}{\sum\limits_{n=1}^{N} \frac{\dot{m}_{H_2}}{(1 + i)^n}}
$$



where ![](data:image/png;base64,) is the cost of the compressors (inclusive of all the stages of the capital cost analyzed in section 3 above), ![](data:image/png;base64,) is the operating cost of the compressors, ![](data:image/png;base64,) is the mass of ![](data:image/png;base64,) produced by the plant annually, _n_ is the year, ![](data:image/png;base64,) is the lifetime of the plant (20 years), and _i_ is the discount rate. ![](data:image/png;base64,) are computed considering the electricity cost that power the compressors, the operational time, and the compression power consumption, ![](data:image/png;base64,), computed as


$$

P_{comp} = \dot{m}_k \frac{1}{\eta_{comp}} \frac{\gamma_k}{\gamma_k - 1} RT \left( \beta^{\frac{\gamma_k - 1}{\gamma_k}} - 1 \right)
$$



where ${\dot{\mathrm{m}}}_\mathrm{k}$is the mass flow rate of the gas $(\mathrm{H}_\mathrm{2} or \mathrm{O}_\mathrm{2}), \mathrm{\eta}_{\mathrm{comp}}$ is the compression efficiency, $\gamma_\mathrm{k}$ is the heat capacity ratio of the gas, $\beta$ is the pressure ratio between the inlet and outlet (in this case \beta = 200, since the ME electrolyzer operates at 1 bar and the selling pressure of $\mathrm{H}_\mathrm{2}$ is 200 bar).
